it.unive.dais.legodroid.lib

Class EV3.Api

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unive.dais.legodroid.lib.EV3.Api
  • Enclosing class:
    EV3

    public static class EV3.Api
extends java.lang.Object
    This inner class contains the operations that can be performed to control the EV3 brick. Accesing sensors, moving motors etc. are operations that can be performed only by calling methods of this class. Instances of this class cannot be created by calling a constructor: an instance can only be obtained from the argument of the callback passed to method EV3.run(Consumer). Methods offered by this class belong to two categories: sensor and motor methods are high level operations, though users can directly send low-level commands to the EV3 brick by calling getSiValue(byte, int, int, int) and getPercentValue(byte, int, int, int) methods.
    See Also:
    getSiValue(byte, int, int, int), getPercentValue(byte, int, int, int)

      • soundTone

        public void soundTone(int volume,
                      int freq,
                      int duration)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Play a sound tone on the EV3 brick.
        Parameters:
        volume - volume within the range [0 - 100].
        freq - frequency in the range [ 250 - 10000 ].
        duration - duration in milliseconds.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thown when communication errors occur.

      • getSiValue

        @NonNull
public java.util.concurrent.Future<float[]> getSiValue(byte port,
                                                                 int type,
                                                                 int mode,
                                                                 int nvalue)
                                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Low level method for sending direct commands to the EV3 brick. This method sends the opInput_Device command READY_SI according to the official EV3 Developer Kit Documentation.
        Parameters:
        port - port number.
        type - type constant as defined in Const, e.g. Const.EV3_TOUCH or Const.EV3_COLOR.
        mode - mode constant as defined in Const, e.g. Const.COL_AMBIENT or Const.GYRO_ANGLE.
        nvalue - number of values the command expects to return in the result array.
        Returns:
        a future object containing an array of 32-bit floats whose length is equal to parameter nvalues.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when communication errors occur.
        See Also:
        LEGO Mindstorms EV3 Firmware Developer Kit

      • getPercentValue

        @NonNull
public java.util.concurrent.Future<short[]> getPercentValue(byte port,
                                                                      int type,
                                                                      int mode,
                                                                      int nvalue)
                                                               throws java.io.IOException
        Low level method for sending direct commands to the EV3 brick. This method sends the opInput_Device command READY_PCT according to the official EV3 Developer Kit Documentation.
        Parameters:
        port - port number.
        type - type constant as defined in Const, e.g. Const.EV3_TOUCH or Const.EV3_COLOR.
        mode - mode constant as defined in Const, e.g. Const.COL_AMBIENT or Const.GYRO_ANGLE.
        nvalue - number of values the command expects to return in the result array.
        Returns:
        a future object containing an array of 16-bit integers whose length is equal to parameter nvalues.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when communication errors occur.
        See Also:
        LEGO Mindstorms EV3 Firmware Developer Kit

      • execAsync

        @NonNull
public <T> java.util.concurrent.FutureTask<T> execAsync(@NonNull
                                                                  java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> c)
        Low level method to execute the callback passed as argument within an Android FutureTask. The Executor in charge of the executing the function the is a builtin single-threaded executor.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the return type of the callback.
        Parameters:
        c - functional object of type Callable.
        Returns:
        a FutureTask object hosting the result of type T.

      • send

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<Reply> send(int reservation,
                                               @NonNull
                                               Bytecode bc)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Low level send command with reply.
        Parameters:
        reservation - global reservation for the result in bytes.
        bc - object of type Bytecode representing the command to be sent.
        Returns:
        a Future object hosting the Reply object wrapping the reply by EV3.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when communication errors occur.
        See Also:
        LEGO Mindstorms EV3 Firmware Developer Kit
